titleStmt.title: New English Canaan, or New Canaan containing an abstract of New England, composed in three bookes : the first booke setting forth the originall of the natives, their manners and customes, together with their tractable nature and love towards the English : the second booke setting forth the naturall indowments of the countrie, and what staple commodities it yeeldeth : the third booke setting forth what people are planted there, their prosperity, what remarkable accidents have happened since the first planting of it, together with their tenents, and practise of their church / written by Thomas Morton ...
titleStmt.author: Morton, Thomas, 1564-1659.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Charles Greene, and are sold in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Date of imprint suggested by STC (2nd ed.).
Imperfect: tightly bound, with some loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
